content:
Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the world’s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving people’s ability to move – whether for work or play.
 
What we do: 
The Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer is responsible for developing design solutions that support the overall long-term goals of the Test and Evaluation Instrumentation Team. The role involves creating standard processes and procedures and working closely with the design team at every stage, from conceptual to detail design. It requires building prototypes and flight test aircraft and developing design solutions to support the installation of test instrumentation and data-gathering systems to meet test program objectives. The role also involves collaborating closely with all technical development teams.
This position will be required to work on-site 5 days a week.
What you can do:
Use creativity and engineering principles towards the design of a mechanical structure, mechanism and/or system.
Design mechanical / structural systems and products based on a set of given and derived requirements
Work directly with project Instrumentation Engineers to understand the project instrumentation installation requirements.
Work directly with System engineering to collect and understand the project design requirements
Experience crafting CNC machining, additive manufacturing and sheet metal components
Work with structural analysis team to verify capabilities of structure before fabrication
Hold design reviews and presentations
Participate and provide guidance in design reviews/brainstorming sessions
Identify process deficiencies and develop solutions for improvement
Prepare and author various manuals / templates such as design standards, procedures, work instructions, and processes
Provide solutions to manufacturing assembly
Prepare design reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information
Create 3D models of design details using Catia
Prepare manufacturing drawings using GD&T for manufacturability and repeatability in Catia
Creation and maintenance of a Bill of Materials for one or more projects
Manage relationships with key material and component vendors
Provide technical support to vendors and manufacturing teams
Ensure compliance with safety / regulatory standards as required
Complete other tasks as assigned by manager
May require up to 30% of domestic and international travel
Other duties as assigned
What you can contribute:
Bachelor's degree in engineering or related field required
A minimum of five (5) years of mechanical design experience (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)
Experience in aircraft or automotive instrumentation design
Experience in flight test instrumentation preferred
Experience with project management, development programs, and prototyping
Knowledge of ASME Y14.5 Standards and Catia
Highly collaborative and works well both independently and with a team
Internal and external customer focus
Ability to solve complex mechanical design problems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proactive delivery of communication and follow up
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Must have the ability to independently prioritize and accomplish work within time constraints
Proficiency with Excel VLOOKUP, pivot tables, MS Office Suite
